text: in my business I can put up with a lot
but I cannot put up with my cash
registers not being able to work because
then that's not stay on the entire
company and since we've gone to AWS we
have been up 100% of the time and I
think to me that's the most important
thing Goodwill Industries is a
not-for-profit organization we're part
of a Goodwill Industries of North
America there's 163 Goodwill's in North
America we all are independent 501 C 3 s
we operate under defined territory a
currently goodwill has approximately 850
employees then about another 150 what we
call clients employees people though I'm
not like people with disabilities who we
treat as employees our mission has
always been to put people to work to
help me realize their economic potential
some of the business issues that
Goodwill Industries was facing before
moving to Amazon Web Services were
constant outages when we had physical
servers in the closet having to replace
servers every couple of years due to the
depreciation that you would get with
Hardware outages at our stores our
schools and our offices preventing our
employees from working in our stores
from operating and our students from
learning when I was shopping for a
backup solution I noticed that there was
very little out there
we found cloud protection manager
through the AWS marketplace AWS was
clearly for us the right choice
cloud protection manager by n2w software
is a backup and disaster recovery
solution that allows us to protect our
data our systems and our assets you
can't really put a price on peace of
mind and with a backup solution as
proven as cloud protection manager by
n2w
we're backing up each one of our servers
or financial servers our point-of-sale
systems on an hourly basis 24 hours a
day it allows me to restore a server
within moments of a data or server
failure there's no loss downtime because
we're able to turn servers on from a
backup image immediately after a failure
when we ordered the cloud protection
manager software from the AWS
marketplace we were able to spin it up
into an image and essentially enable the
services within a couple of hours the
benefit of evaluating or buying software
from AWS marketplaces
most of the software is available for
fully functional trial so it gives you
the opportunity to check out new
solutions test technology and work with
their support team to make sure that
it's a fit for you before you know
sinking a cost into an investment that
you might not like otherwise the
benefits of AWS pay-as-you-go and the
benefits of being able to deploy
software instantaneously anywhere in the
world you're able to scale immediately
you're able to stretch the size of the
environment to accommodate you know your
technology and your business needs and
you're also able to shrink the size of
the environment and not pay for
resources or run a bloated environment
that you don't need so I would say that
any businessperson that is looking to
implement this type of a solution if you
implement Amazon Web Services today then
that takes one giant headache off of
your plate why not let AWS worry about
your IT infrastructure then you can
worry about your business
